DOC.brief_summary: At Cedars-Sinai Medical Center , investigator develop novel curriculum 6-week psycho-educationally-based , cognitive behavioral program help patient subjective cognitive complaint cancer treatment , title Emerging Haze™ ( Haze ) . Each series meet week 2-2.5 hour 6 week . The objective study quantify impact trainee-taught Emerging Haze course gynecologic cancer survivor ' self-report cognitive change base change FACT-Cog score .
DOC.brief_title: Emerging From Haze Gynecologic Cancer Survivors
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis stage gynecologic cancer include ovarian , uterine/endometrial , cervical , vulvar , vaginal cancer Treated chemotherapy solely combination surgery , radiation , and/or hormonal therapy Female , age ≥ 18 year . FACTCog score < 59 PCI sub scale Eligible 2 month ( 60 ±5 day ) complete active cancer treatment exception longterm hormonal treatment Subjective complaint cognitive concern time enrollment Must able understand communicate proficiently English Ability understand willingness sign write informed consent . Agree complete study survey Patients significant personality disorder unstable psychiatric disorder ( include active major depression , substance abuse , psychosis bipolar disorder ) assess interview clinician Patients know brain metastasis , history brain metastasis radiation brain . Patients history stroke preexist neurological condition may contribute cognitive dysfunction . NonEnglish speaker Receiving treatment another malignancy breast cancer Uncontrolled intercurrent illness include , limited , ongoing active infection , chronic anemia , uncontrolled hypothyroidism , symptomatic congestive heart failure , unstable angina pectoris , uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia , psychiatric illness/social situation would limit compliance study requirement .
